text: Valentine's Day means love is in the air
for the sixty-six percent of US adults
either married or in relationships so in
this wired world of ours what role does
tech play in how we live in love a new
survey by the pew research center of
adult couples on the internet shed some
light tech can mean trust sixty-seven
percent of people share passwords to
online accounts with their partners
isn't that sweet well it's not all
romance older couples tend to use tech
for logistics thirty-eight percent of
those in a relationship for over ten
years share an email address only ten
percent do in younger relationships and
fourteen percent of these couples share
a social media profile and maybe love
gives way to laziness to a quarter of
adults have texted a partner while they
were both at home in the same place but
let's give them a pass after all nine
percent of adults have made up via text
or online after an argument still it's
the young people having the most fun
with text messages forty-four percent of
young cell phone owners have received
those racy texts known as sexts slightly
older people are more likely to send a
sext instead of receiving one and
sexting numbers are on the rise across
all age groups pew research found
sexting stats follow the rise in
smartphone use as it gets easier and
easier to snap and send amorous pics
overall almost a quarter of people say
they've felt closer to their partner
because of something written online or
in a text message hmmm well a timeline
of tweets one day replace the box of
chocolates David Bowie BBC News
Washington
